message.content:
Below is a detailed breakdown of the information in the form:

```json
{
  "amendment_number": 4,
  "contract_number": "0000000000000000000032780",
  "intro_text": "This is an Amendment to the Contract ('Contract') entered into by and between the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration Division of Disability and Rehabilitative Services (the 'State' or 'FSSA' or 'DDRS') and Human Services Research Institute (the 'Contractor') approved by the last State signatory on April 5, 2019. The Contractor provides guidance to execute the development of newly identified Home and Community Based Service waivers for the ID/DD population. In consideration of the mutual undertakings and covenants hereinafter set forth, the parties agree as follows:",
  "terms": [
    "The Contract is hereby extended for an additional period of 6 months. It shall terminate on January 31, 2023.",
    "EXHIBIT 4 - SUPPLEMENTAL SCOPE OF WORK, which is supplemental to and does not replace Exhibit 2.A, is attached hereto and incorporated herein.",
    "EXHIBIT 5 - SUPPLEMENTAL BUDGET, which is supplemental to and does not replace Exhibit 3, is attached hereto and incorporated herein.",
    "The consideration during this extension period is $395,000. Total remuneration under the Contract is not to exceed $1,267,887.20.",
    "The Contract is amended by adding the following:"
  ],
  "minority_business_enterprise_compliance": "As required by 25 IAC 5-6-2(b), the following Division certified MBE or WBE subcontractor(s) will be participating in this Contract during the extension period. This participation represents no change to the original MBE and/or WBE commitment.",
  "mbe_wbe_details": {
    "type": "WBE",
    "phone": "317-509-1621",
    "company_name": "Lawrance Policy Consulting",
    "scope_of_products_services": "Policy Consulting",
    "utilization_date": "2/1/19 - End of Contract Term",
    "total_contract_percent": 7.50
  },
  "notifications": "A copy of each subcontractor agreement must be submitted to the Division of Supplier Diversity within thirty (30) days of the effective date of this Amendment. The subcontractor agreements may be uploaded into Pay Audit (Indiana's subcontractor payment auditing system), emailed to MWBECompliance@idoa.IN.gov, or mailed to the Division of Supplier Diversity, 402 W. Washington Street Room W-462, Indianapolis IN 46204. Failure to provide a copy of any subcontractor agreement may be deemed a violation of the rules governing MBE/WBE procurement and may result in sanctions allowable under 25 IAC 5-7-8. Requests for changes must be submitted to MWBECompliance@idoa.IN.gov for review and approval before changing the participation plan submitted in connection with this Amendment.",
  "monthly_reporting": "The Contractor shall report payments made to Division of Supplier Diversity certified subcontractors under this Contract on a monthly basis using Pay Audit. The Contractor shall notify subcontractors that they must confirm payments received from Contractor in Pay Audit. The Pay Audit system can be accessed on the IDOA webpage at: www.in.gov/idoa/mwbe/payaudit.htm. Contractor may also be required to report Division."
}
```

This JSON provides a structured representation of the document's key elements and information.
